medical_history.chief_complaint: Nausea and vomiting that are minimally responsive to medication.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms of nausea and vomiting have been escalating over several months. They became minimally responsive to Zofran and required additional premedication with Ativan. The patient also reports associated minimal dull epigastric pain and occasional nighttime fevers/sweats a few times per week, with fluctuating diarrhea/constipation and occasional streaks of blood consistent with hemorrhoids.
medical_history.past_medical_history: HIV with CD4 count of 186, undetectable viral load; epilepsy since infancy; migraines; depression/panic attacks; low testosterone; anal dysplasia monitored by serial Pap smears; hemorrhoids.
medical_history.family_history: Grandfather with pancreatic cancer, grandmother with lung cancer, another grandfather with lung cancer, an uncle with lymphoma; family history of bipolar disorder and epilepsy; no history of anal, colon, cervical or head/neck cancer.
